TONIGHT ON THE CBS EVENING NEWSHere is 
      an early preview of what we are planning for tonight's CBS EVENING NEWS 
      from Anchor and Managing Editor, Katie Couric... Hi 
      everyone, We'll be broadcasting another hour-long special edition 
      of the CBS Evening News tonight from the campus of Virginia 
      Tech, where President Bush and the first lady today joined students, 
      faculty and the extended university community in mourning the dozens who 
      died in yesterday's horrifying massacre. Bob Orr will tell 
      you more about Cho Seung-Hui, the 23-year-old English major responsible 
      for killing 32 people before turning a gun on himself. Officials haven't 
      yet put together a full picture of Cho, saying only that "he was a loner." 
      But there are some clues that might shed light on his motivation, and 
      we'll share those with you. The identities of the victims are 
      still being released, but it is already clear that Cho's bullets cut 
      across a wide swatch of the campus population. The dead range from bright 
      college freshmen to a 76-year-old internationally renowned engineering 
      professor. Cynthia Bowers will bring you portraits of those 
      murdered. Also, Sharyn Alfonsi will report on what happened 
      in the critical two hours when Cho eluded police. Thalia 
      Assuras will chronicle the grieving process on campus. And our 
      technology correspondent, Daniel Sieberg, will take a look at 
      social networking online in the wake of the tragedy. I hope 
      you'll join us tonight, and be sure to tune in at 10 p.m. ET to a special 
      edition of 48 Hours this evening called Anatomy of a 
      Rampage. Thanks, Katie For more 
      information on these stories, please click on the following links:

      on for Wednesday's broadcast: We'll continue to follow the 
      tragic Virginia Tech story - as more victims are identified and more 
      information emerges. We will have more on this developing story, Wednesday

TONIGHT ON DAVID 
      LETTERMANCraig Ferguson, host of CBS' The Late Late 
      Show with Craig Ferguson will join Dave tonight along with 
      "Vote for the Worst" website creator Dave Della Terza... Plus, musical 
      guest Avril Lavigne! 



 
WEDNESDAY
MORNING ON THE EARLY SHOWHarry 
      Smith and Kelly Wallace will anchor THE EARLY 
      SHOW from Blacksburg, VA. Russ Mitchell anchors from New 
      York. Dave Price will bring us the weather. Hannah Storm and 
      Julie Chen are off. We will continue to focus on the 
      "MASSACRE AT VIRGINIA TECH." We will have the latest on the 
      alleged shooter, the victims, and how the community is healing following 
      such a devastating tragedy including: THE SHOOTER: CBS News 
      Correspondent Sharyl Attkisson will take an in-depth look at the 
      alleged gunman, Cho Seung-Hui. What drove him to release fire on his 
      fellow students? GOVERNOR KAINE: Governor Tim Kaine has 
      spoken out on the horror at Virginia Tech. We will speak to him Wednesday 
      about the devastating shootings. OMAR SAMAHA: Omar's 
      sister, Reema, was killed Monday. He and his family drove to Blacksburg to 
      find solace in the community. We will speak with Omar Wednesday morning. 
      GRIEVING ONLINE: We'll take a look at how people are 
      finding solace in online communities. If you would like more 
      information on any of these stories or the broadcast, please click on the 
      following address and e-mail us: earlyshow@cbs.com
